page.title: 14Housing in Sedlescombe
page.content:
Whatlington is a dispersed village settlement of predominantly old houses. The 20th. century has seen some very slight infill.
Sedlescombe has spread from its core around the Village Green, north along the A229, and East along Brede Lane. Two private estates provide expensive retirement homes, and a third, larger family dwellings.
A council estate exists to the East of the village and some families are starting to buy their properties. Modern houses are mainly of local red brick, and a few are tile hung and some are weather-boarded.
